intro: Tragia correae, commonly known as the Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the dry season. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Tragia correae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and dry grasslands.
